"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-11-12 19:53:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bf435ef7ab12b97bffa08956fd094a414cabc6e6', 'message': "libvirt: Don't check config disk during cold migration

The resize operation, which implements both resize and cold migration
does:

  resize_instance() (on source)
    driver.migrate_disk_and_power_off()
    destination.finish_resize()

  finish_resize() (on destination)
    driver.finish_migration()

Therefore, whenever we call the driver's finish_migration, it is in
the context that we previously called the driver's
migrate_disk_and_power_off().

Note that migrate_disk_and_power_off iterates over disk_info, and
copies all disks present except the swap disk. disk_info_text is
generated by get_instance_disk_info, which in turn gets its list of
disks from libvirt, and contains the config disk. Therefore, if the
instance has a config disk, it was copied from the source to the
destination in migrate_disk_and_power_off(). There is no need to be
explicit about the disk, because this is the expected contract of
migrate_disk_and_power_off(). We are explicit in the single case that
we don't do this (swap disks).

So, we know that:

1. The config disk is already present if it is required.
2. The config disk does not have a backing file.
3. The config disk does not need to be resized.

There is therefore nothing for finish_migration() to do with respect
to config drives. _create_configdrive should refuse to overwrite it,
but calling it is redundant and confusing.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ie4d5904e7bc2dcea8aa3f6c84c30b28431a232dc

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't check config disk during cold migration

The resize operation, which implements both resize and cold migration
does:

  resize_instance() (on source)
    driver.migrate_disk_and_power_off()
    destination.finish_resize()

  finish_resize() (on destination)
    driver.finish_migration()

Therefore, whenever we call the driver's finish_migration, it is in
the context that we previously called the driver's
migrate_disk_and_power_off().

Note that migrate_disk_and_power_off iterates over disk_info, and
copies all disks present except the swap disk. disk_info_text is
generated by get_instance_disk_info, which in turn gets its list of
disks from libvirt, and contains the config disk. Therefore, if the
instance has a config disk, it was copied from the source to the
destination in migrate_disk_and_power_off(). There is no need to be
explicit about the disk, because this is the expected contract of
migrate_disk_and_power_off(). We are explicit in the single case that
we don't do this (swap disks).

So, we know that:

1. The config disk is already present if it is required.
2. The config disk does not have a backing file.
3. The config disk does not need to be resized.

There is therefore nothing for finish_migration() to do with respect
to config drives. _create_configdrive should refuse to overwrite it,
but calling it is redundant and confusing.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ie4d5904e7bc2dcea8aa3f6c84c30b28431a232dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/337158/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Don't call _create_image from finish_migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 11:51:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/542011d0ec5f34942d3966afdad43d3d8d66598f', 'message': "libvirt: Don't call _create_image from finish_migration

finish_migration does not create disks, making a call to _create_image
an extremely poor fit. Supporting this use of _create_image required
both _create_image and cache() to have behaviours unrelated to the
creation of disks, which in turn made the code harder to understand
and improve.

We continue to create external boot disks (kernel and ramdisk), and
the swap disk. However, the root disk and ephemeral disks have been
copied by migrate_disk_and_power_off. Instead of calling the relevant
create function (which currently still results in a call to cache()),
we now explicitly check the backing disk and resize these disks. This
means that we no longer rely on this behaviour in cache(), paving the
way to the replacement of this method. Note that we can also remove
the comment to _create_image about implicit behaviour.

We also move root disk snapshot creation from _create_image to the
caller. Note that we no longer need to test task_state because we're
doing it explicitly in finish_migration.

Change-Id: Ia085e218d225bff6451d6f3040263f7152673f37

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't call _create_image from finish_migration

finish_migration does not create disks, making a call to _create_image
an extremely poor fit. Supporting this use of _create_image required
both _create_image and cache() to have behaviours unrelated to the
creation of disks, which in turn made the code harder to understand
and improve.

We continue to create external boot disks (kernel and ramdisk), and
the swap disk. However, the root disk and ephemeral disks have been
copied by migrate_disk_and_power_off. Instead of calling the relevant
create function (which currently still results in a call to cache()),
we now explicitly check the backing disk and resize these disks. This
means that we no longer rely on this behaviour in cache(), paving the
way to the replacement of this method. Note that we can also remove
the comment to _create_image about implicit behaviour.

We also move root disk snapshot creation from _create_image to the
caller. Note that we no longer need to test task_state because we're
doing it explicitly in finish_migration.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ia085e218d225bff6451d6f3040263f7152673f37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/337160/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Add ensure_backing_from_*

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. ensure_backing_from_func() and
ensure_backing_from_image() perform the same function except they:

* do it explicitly.
* will not create a disk if it doesn't exist.

The latter is a feature for finish_migration which explicitly only
requires backing files to be created.

Note that the only image backend which requires these checks is Qcow2,
as no other backend uses a backing file.

TODO: Need to add tests for DiskCreationProxy interfaces

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I287b1cd654d1665a3cb7aeac8b80f307aef4f04a

commit_message:
libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I81374efd3cd7911a9651bef2812d82b8878129d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/406870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: don't test cache() in test_driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 10:14:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dac37d2a98418b773db7554525e84a5d9f3da91a', 'message': "libvirt: don't test cache() in test_driver

Since change Ie5d47f55 libvirt.driver has not called Image.cache()
directly, instead calling either create_from_image() or
create_from_func() instead as appropriate. These 2 functions are
implemented in the Image base class as wrappers around cache(). Up to
this point, the transformations in this refactor series have been
intended to be mostly non-functional: just code motion. Because we
have continue to test calls to cache() and not modified the tests
during the transformation, we have had a level of assurance from the
unit tests that we have not changed the existing behaviour.

With change Ie5d47f55 we moved the complexity of image side-loading
images from the source host into create_from_*(). Image side-loading
is now thoroughly unit tested by
test_imagebackend.RefactorShimTestCase.

In change I125e8fa0 we further refactored the imagebackend calls made
by _create_image into StoragePolicy. StoragePolicy exposes disk
creation to libvirt.driver() with a single create() call and includes
its own tests for the details of disk creation.

These 2 changes mean that tests in test_driver which test the details
of disk creation are redundant.

With this change, we update fake_imagebackend to no longer execute
create_from_*(), which  means that the tests no longer execute cache()
and we can no longer test calls to cache(). Instead we introduce a new
module, fake_storagepolicy which allows us to test calls at the much
higher-level StoragePolicy boundary. With this change, tests no longer
need to be concerned with the details of disk creation, as
StoragePolicy abstracts the details of local_root, ephemerals, swap,
and config_disk. Instead tests need only assert that create() was
called on the disks returned by StoragePolicy.

This covers call paths which use LibvirtDriver._create_image().  There
are additionally call paths which use
LibvirtDriver._create_images_and_backing(), which continue to call
create_from_*(). These tests are updated to assert calls to the
relevant create_from_*() function directly. Future patches will
replace callers of _create_images_and_backing with StoragePolicy, but
these changes will be functional, and will involve changing the tests
accordingly.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I0c2c33cc35d1a54bbb09d3b4cb67dffb0995b09b

commit_message:
libvirt: don't test cache() in test_driver

Since change Ie5d47f55 libvirt.driver has not called Image.cache()
directly, instead calling either create_from_image() or
create_from_func() instead as appropriate. These 2 functions are
implemented in the Image base class as wrappers around cache(). Up to
this point, the transformations in this refactor series have been
intended to be mostly non-functional: just code motion. Because we
have continue to test calls to cache() and not modified the tests
during the transformation, we have had a level of assurance from the
unit tests that we have not changed the existing behaviour.

With change Ie5d47f55 we moved the complexity of image side-loading
images from the source host into create_from_*(). Image side-loading
is now thoroughly unit tested by
test_imagebackend.RefactorShimTestCase.

In change I125e8fa0 we further refactored the imagebackend calls made
by _create_image into StoragePolicy. StoragePolicy exposes disk
creation to libvirt.driver() with a single create() call and includes
its own tests for the details of disk creation.

These 2 changes mean that tests in test_driver which test the details
of disk creation are redundant.

With this change, we update fake_imagebackend to no longer execute
create_from_*(), which  means that the tests no longer execute cache()
and we can no longer test calls to cache(). Instead we introduce a new
module, fake_storagepolicy which allows us to test calls at the much
higher-level StoragePolicy boundary. With this change, tests no longer
need to be concerned with the details of disk creation, as
StoragePolicy abstracts the details of local_root, ephemerals, swap,
and config_disk. Instead tests need only assert that create() was
called on the disks returned by StoragePolicy.

This covers call paths which use LibvirtDriver._create_image().  There
are additionally call paths which use
LibvirtDriver._create_images_and_backing(), which continue to call
create_from_*(). These tests are updated to assert calls to the
relevant create_from_*() function directly. Future patches will
replace callers of _create_images_and_backing with StoragePolicy, but
these changes will be functional, and will involve changing the tests
accordingly.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I0c2c33cc35d1a54bbb09d3b4cb67dffb0995b09b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/406869/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Refactor _create_image into storagepolicy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 18:09:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ce63b546cfb6b3b5ef5d20a1e8e13a47e2f929a9', 'message': "libvirt: Refactor _create_image into storagepolicy

_create_image contains logic to:

* Iterate over all of an instance's disks
* Create those disks

This is problematic for a few reasons. Firstly, finish_migration wants
to iterate over all of an instance's disks but *not* create them, only
check and resize them. It currently re-uses _create_image in a manner
which relies on the 'all the things' behaviour of cache(), which is
confusing and error-prone.

Secondly, rescue doesn't need to iterate over all disks. It gets round
this by not passing in block_device_info, but this is confusing.

Lastly, there is a parallel implementation of this functionality in
_create_images_and_backing using different data, which creates disks
differently. We would like the functionality of _create_image to be
re-usable in that context to avoid edge cases where the behaviours are
different.

This change introduces the StoragePolicy object, which is a new
canonical source for an instance's disks. It exposes the disk
iteration of _create_iteration in its methods. Additionally, instead
of returning an Image object it returns a DiskCreationProxy object.
This object wraps the Image and adds an addition method, create(),
taking no arguments. This means that the caller can iterate over disks
in a manner consistent with _create_image without creating them if
that isn't required. This change is required for finish_migration().

Note that the changes in test_driver are intentionally minimal. In
fact, they are almost entirely mechanical due to the changed interface
of _create_image() requiring a StoragePolicy object. The substantive
changes are:

* tests which only tested _create_ephemeral, _create_swap, and
  _is_supported_fs move to test_storagepolicy, which is where the
  functions under test have moved. The tests are updated to use mock
  in place of mox, but are otherwise identical.

* We now create config disk, kernel, and ramdisk as 'flat' instead of
  'raw'. These are completely equivalent.

The lack of changes in test_driver means that we are continuing to
test calls all the way down to imagebackend.Image.cache, which give us
a degree of confidence that we haven't introduced regressions. With
this more practical separation of logic, we can now incrementally make
tests in test_driver more 'unity' by stopping at the storagepolicy
boundary. Over time this should eliminate a significant number of
tests in test_driver.

TODO: Add comprehensive tests for storagepolicy.

Change-Id: I125e8fa06e7e095aca092d986947e8bd68c16914

* Create those disks

which relies on the 'all the things' behaviour of cache(), which is
confusing and error-prone.

differently. We would like the functionality of _create_image to be
re-usable in that context to avoid edge cases where the behaviours are

canonical source for an instance's disks. It exposes the disk
iteration of _create_iteration in its methods. Additionally, instead
of returning an Image object it returns a DiskCreationProxy object.
This object wraps the Image and adds an addition method, create(),
taking no arguments. This means that the caller can iterate over disks
in a manner consistent with _create_image without creating them if
that isn't required. This change is required for finish_migration().

Note that the changes in test_driver are intentionally minimal. In
fact, they are almost entirely mechanical due to the changed interface
of _create_image() requiring a StoragePolicy object. The substantive
changes are:

* tests which only tested _create_ephemeral, _create_swap, and
  _is_supported_fs move to test_storagepolicy, which is where the
  functions under test have moved. The tests are updated to use mock
  in place of mox, but are otherwise identical.

  'raw'. These are completely equivalent.

test calls all the way down to imagebackend.Image.cache, which give us
a degree of confidence that we haven't introduced regressions. With
this more practical separation of logic, we can now incrementally make
tests in test_driver more 'unity' by stopping at the storagepolicy
boundary. Over time this should eliminate a significant number of
tests in test_driver.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I125e8fa06e7e095aca092d986947e8bd68c16914

commit_message:
libvirt: Refactor _create_image into storagepolicy

_create_image contains logic to:

* Iterate over all of an instance's disks
* Create those disks

This is problematic for a few reasons. Firstly, finish_migration wants
to iterate over all of an instance's disks but *not* create them, only
check and resize them. It currently re-uses _create_image in a manner
which relies on the 'all the things' behaviour of cache(), which is
confusing and error-prone.

Secondly, rescue doesn't need to iterate over all disks. It gets round
this by not passing in block_device_info, but this is confusing.

Lastly, there is a parallel implementation of this functionality in
_create_images_and_backing using different data, which creates disks
differently. We would like the functionality of _create_image to be
re-usable in that context to avoid edge cases where the behaviours are
different.

This change introduces the StoragePolicy object, which is a new
canonical source for an instance's disks. It exposes the disk
iteration of _create_iteration in its methods. Additionally, instead
of returning an Image object it returns a DiskCreationProxy object.
This object wraps the Image and adds an addition method, create(),
taking no arguments. This means that the caller can iterate over disks
in a manner consistent with _create_image without creating them if
that isn't required. This change is required for finish_migration().

Note that the changes in test_driver are intentionally minimal. In
fact, they are almost entirely mechanical due to the changed interface
of _create_image() requiring a StoragePolicy object. The substantive
changes are:

* tests which only tested _create_ephemeral, _create_swap, and
  _is_supported_fs move to test_storagepolicy, which is where the
  functions under test have moved. The tests are updated to use mock
  in place of mox, but are otherwise identical.

* We now create config disk, kernel, and ramdisk as 'flat' instead of
  'raw'. These are completely equivalent.

The lack of changes in test_driver means that we are continuing to
test calls all the way down to imagebackend.Image.cache, which give us
a degree of confidence that we haven't introduced regressions. With
this more practical separation of logic, we can now incrementally make
tests in test_driver more 'unity' by stopping at the storagepolicy
boundary. Over time this should eliminate a significant number of
tests in test_driver.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I125e8fa06e7e095aca092d986947e8bd68c16914

subject: libvirt: Pass is_block_dev explicitly from create_from_func
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 11:18:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ab99df07ef7b4640cf2b1bfcd774b06a9a24950d', 'message': "Pass is_block_dev explicitly from create_from_func

The function passed to create_from_func() needs to know whether it is
writing to a block device because:

1. It will already exist
2. It needs root to write to

The backend is best placed to know this, so we pass it automatically
from the backend rather than from driver.

We also make it a class property, as it is backend, not disk,
specific.

Swap wasn't previously using it, which probably means that swap disks
were broken on LVM. We update _create_swap to follow the pattern of
_create_ephemeral.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I19cf3dfdac257f4fdb362b6f35b413a3bc25b50c

commit_message:
libvirt: Pass is_block_dev explicitly from create_from_func

The function passed to create_from_func() needs to know whether it is
writing to a block device because:

1. It will already exist
2. It needs root to write to

The backend is best placed to know this, so we pass it automatically
from the backend rather than from driver.

We also make it a class property, as it is backend, not disk,
specific.

Swap wasn't previously using it, so we update _create_swap to follow
the pattern of _create_ephemeral.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I19cf3dfdac257f4fdb362b6f35b413a3bc25b50c

subject: libvirt: Add create_from_image and create_from_func to Backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 10:52:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a1572bf685907dd83eef0cf5148768dbe3246ee5', 'message': "Add create_from_image and create_from_func imagebackend methods

This change adds two new methods to imagebackend.Image:
create_from_image and create_from_func. These are implemented as
wrappers around the existing cache() method. Driver is updated such
that there are no longer any callers to cache(). With this change,
cache() continues to be called as before, but via the new interface.

We deliberately make minimal changes to the tests. The two changes
represent actual changes in behaviour introduced by this change. They
are:

* target is now passed to _create_ephemeral and _create_swap as a
  positional argument, not by name

* kernel and ramdisk images were previously downloaded with
  fetch_raw_image. They are now downloaded with fetch_image.

The latter change is a simplification. fetch_raw_image can assume that
the image it is downloading will be used as raw and performs no checks
or conversion. fetch_image will perform some sanity checks and convert
the image format to raw if required. The additional work done by
fetch_image isn't strictly necessary for kernel and ramdisk images,
but is not expensive and makes the code simpler.

The primary achievement of this patch is to move the image fetching
callback complexity from driver to image backend. We are not quite
ready to start replacing create_from_image and create_from_func with
the new implementations with this patch because we still assume some
of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will:

* not overwrite it.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

Change-Id: Ie5d47f55e014c9d4ef47e9d3190fdd6cc80f56f7

This change adds two new methods to imagebackend.Image:

that there are no longer any callers to cache(). With this change,

We deliberately make minimal changes to the tests. The two changes
represent actual changes in behaviour introduced by this change. They
are:

* target is now passed to _create_ephemeral and _create_swap as a
  positional argument, not by name

* kernel and ramdisk images were previously downloaded with
  fetch_raw_image. They are now downloaded with fetch_image.

The latter change is a simplification. fetch_raw_image can assume that

of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will:

* not overwrite it.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

We add tests for the shim code which replace equivalent fallback tests
test_create_image_not_exist_fallback and

when the new Rbd backend code lands in change I06133d73.

"}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-08-01 15:37:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/549b74cadcffbba49cec9b4b0b8be93d881d95f4', 'message': "libvirt: Add create_from_image and create_from_func to Backend

This change adds two new methods to imagebackend.Image:
create_from_image and create_from_func. These are implemented as
wrappers around the existing cache() method. Driver is updated such
that there are no longer any callers to cache(). With this change,
cache() continues to be called as before, but via the new interface.

We deliberately make minimal changes to the tests. The two changes in
test_driver represent actual changes in behaviour introduced by this
change. They are:

* target is now passed to _create_ephemeral and _create_swap as a
  positional argument, not by name

* kernel and ramdisk images were previously downloaded with
  fetch_raw_image. They are now downloaded with fetch_image.

The latter change is a simplification. fetch_raw_image can assume that
the image it is downloading will be used as raw and performs no checks
or conversion. fetch_image will perform some sanity checks and convert
the image format to raw if required. The additional work done by
fetch_image isn't strictly necessary for kernel and ramdisk images,
but is not expensive and makes the code simpler.

The primary achievement of this patch is to move the image fetching
callback complexity from driver to image backend. We are not quite
ready to start replacing create_from_image and create_from_func with
the new implementations with this patch because we still assume some
of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will:

* not overwrite it.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

We add tests for the shim code which replace equivalent fallback tests
test_create_image_not_exist_fallback and
test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback, and exceed it. Note that we
don't add tests for the SUPPORTS_CLONE functionality. This isn't a
test regression, because it has never been tested. It will be tested
when the new Rbd backend code lands in change I06133d73.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: Ie5d47f55e014c9d4ef47e9d3190fdd6cc80f56f7

"}, {'number': 18, 'created': '2016-11-22 16:59:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ba9f68629a6a61c6d881330ad4fa80ee218f456f', 'message': "libvirt: Add create_from_image and create_from_func to Backend

This change adds two new methods to imagebackend.Image:
create_from_image and create_from_func. These are implemented as
wrappers around the existing cache() method. Driver is updated such
that there are no longer any callers to cache(). With this change,
cache() continues to be called as before, but via the new interface.

We deliberately make minimal changes to the tests. With one exception,
the changes in test_driver represent actual changes in behaviour
introduced by this change. They are:

* _create_image_and_backing now explicitly passes is_block_dev to
  _create_ephemeral, it was previously implicit.

* The unused context argument is no longer passes to _create_ephemeral
  or _create_swap.

* Arguments exclusively for template functions are no longer passed to
  cache(). Note that the template function itself is still called with
  the same arguments as before, save as noted above.

* kernel and ramdisk images were previously downloaded with
  fetch_raw_image. They are now downloaded with fetch_image.

The latter change is a simplification. fetch_raw_image can assume that
the image it is downloading will be used as raw and performs no checks
or conversion. fetch_image will perform some sanity checks and convert
the image format to raw if required. The additional work done by
fetch_image isn't strictly necessary for kernel and ramdisk images,
but is not expensive and makes the code simpler.

The test change to _create_and_inject_local_root is not a change in
behaviour. It reflects that we now pass the root disk object in rather
than create it in the function.

The primary achievement of this patch is to move the image fetching
callback complexity from driver to image backend. We are not quite
ready to start replacing create_from_image and create_from_func with
the new implementations with this patch because we still assume some
of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will do the following in
addition to creating it if it does not exist:

* not overwrite it if it already exists.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

We add tests for the shim code which replace equivalent fallback tests
test_create_image_not_exist_fallback and
test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback, and exceed it. Note that we
don't add tests for the SUPPORTS_CLONE functionality. This isn't a
test regression, because it has never been tested. It will be tested
when the new Rbd backend code lands in change I06133d73.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ie5d47f55e014c9d4ef47e9d3190fdd6cc80f56f7

the new implementations with this patch because we still assume some
of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will do the following in
addition to creating it if it does not exist:

* not overwrite it if it already exists.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

We add tests for the shim code which replace equivalent fallback tests
test_create_image_not_exist_fallback and
test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback, and exceed it. Note that we
don't add tests for the SUPPORTS_CLONE functionality. This isn't a
test regression, because it has never been tested. It will be tested
when the new Rbd backend code lands in change I06133d73.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ie5d47f55e014c9d4ef47e9d3190fdd6cc80f56f7

commit_message:
libvirt: Add create_from_image and create_from_func to Backend

This change adds two new methods to imagebackend.Image:
create_from_image and create_from_func. These are implemented as
wrappers around the existing cache() method. Driver is updated such
that there are no longer any callers to cache(). With this change,
cache() continues to be called as before, but via the new interface.

We deliberately make minimal changes to the tests. With one exception,
the changes in test_driver represent actual changes in behaviour
introduced by this change. They are:

* _create_image_and_backing now explicitly passes is_block_dev to
  _create_ephemeral, it was previously implicit.

* The unused context argument is no longer passes to _create_ephemeral
  or _create_swap.

* Arguments exclusively for template functions are no longer passed to
  cache(). Note that the template function itself is still called with
  the same arguments as before, save as noted above.

* kernel and ramdisk images were previously downloaded with
  fetch_raw_image. They are now downloaded with fetch_image.

The latter change is a simplification. fetch_raw_image can assume that
the image it is downloading will be used as raw and performs no checks
or conversion. fetch_image will perform some sanity checks and convert
the image format to raw if required. The additional work done by
fetch_image isn't strictly necessary for kernel and ramdisk images,
but is not expensive and makes the code simpler.

The test change to _create_and_inject_local_root is not a change in
behaviour. It reflects that we now pass the root disk object in rather
than create it in the function.

The primary achievement of this patch is to move the image fetching
callback complexity from driver to image backend. We are not quite
ready to start replacing create_from_image and create_from_func with
the new implementations with this patch because we still assume some
of the quirks of cache()'s behaviour. Specifically, we assume that
calling create_from_*() on an existing image will do the following in
addition to creating it if it does not exist:

* not overwrite it if it already exists.
* resize it.
* check and recreate its backing file if required.

We add tests for the shim code which replace equivalent fallback tests
test_create_image_not_exist_fallback and
test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback, and exceed it. Note that we
don't add tests for the SUPPORTS_CLONE functionality. This isn't a
test regression, because it has never been tested. It will be tested
when the new Rbd backend code lands in change I06133d73.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ie5d47f55e014c9d4ef47e9d3190fdd6cc80f56f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/333244/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove _create_image from driver

There are only 2 remaining callers of _create_image: spawn and rescue.
As they have different requirements of the function, we split the
functionality out into the 2 separate callers to make them easier to
follow.

We remove the last 3 tests which call _create_image, all of which have
more thorough coverage elsewhere:

* test_create_image_ephemerals

rescue does not touch ephemerals, only spawn. The creation of
ephemerals by spawn is tested by test_spawn_from_volume_no_image_ref,
test_spawn_from_volume_with_image_ref, and test_spawn_from_image.

* test_create_image_initrd

The creation of external boot disks by rescue is tested by test_rescue
and test_rescue_config_drive. We modify the spawn tests to assert the
creation of external boot disks.

* test_create_ephemeral_specified_fs_not_valid

test_ephemerals_invalid_guest_format asserts that ephemerals() raises
InvalidBDMFormat appropriately. The spawn tests listed above assert
that we iterate over ephemerals.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ib48ccdd08ea44bc29dd7a197a29b7deac367ffad

commit_message:
libvirt: Replace _create_images_and_backing in _hard_reboot

_hard_reboot previously called _create_images_and_backing before
attempting to start an instance. The purpose of this check is in case
ImageCacheManager erroneously deleted a backing file which was in use.

_create_images_and_backing will create a top-level disk if it doesn't
exist, which is never required in this context. Additionally,
_create_images_and_backing creates backing files for ephemeral and
swap disks differently to the regular creation code, which would
result in corruption if it were ever required.

The new code simply iterates over all local disks and calls their
ensure_backing method. This uses common backing file creation code.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Idfbca32a27091d674076ffd39396fc1c35a2f3a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/337789/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Replace _create_images_and_backing in pre_live_migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 15:11:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/23d2f142d5f047407d2364f2fc0c7d985261a3ca', 'message': "libvirt: Replace _create_images_and_backing in pre_live_migration

_create_images_and_backing had only a single caller remaining:
pre_live_migration. _create_images_and_backing had some problems in
the context of live migration:

* It had its own code for creating ephemeral disks, which was
  different to the regular code, meaning ephemeral backing disks would
  be more different than usual.

* It did not call the imagebackend code for creating non-qcow2 disks,
  instead calling create_image directly. This obviously won't work for
  non-file backends like LVM.

We replace this with a simple iteration over all local disks, calling
create() on each. This ensures that the disk has been initialised on
the live migration target in the same way it was initialised on the
source host.

_create_images_and_backing has no further callers, so we remove it and
its tests. Test coverage remains because we are now calling existing
common code rather than separate code. Specifically:

* test_create_images_and_backing_qcow2
  test_create_images_and_backing_raw

    Tested by individual backend tests

* test_create_images_and_backing_images_not_exist_no_fallback
  test_create_images_and_backing_images_not_exist_fallback

    Tested by RefactorShimTestCase

* test_create_images_and_backing_images_exist

    This test was only relevant to hard reboot. The new code is never
    called in a context where the target might exist.

* test_create_images_and_backing_ephemeral_gets_created

    Tested in test_pre_live_migration_with_not_shared_instance_path

* test_create_images_and_backing_disk_info_none

    Tested by new test test_pre_live_migration_no_disk_info

The pre_live_migration tests are updated to use mock_backend().

commit_message:
libvirt: Replace _create_images_and_backing in pre_live_migration

_create_images_and_backing had only a single caller remaining:
pre_live_migration. _create_images_and_backing had some problems in
the context of live migration:

* It had its own code for creating ephemeral disks, which was
  different to the regular code, meaning ephemeral backing disks would
  be more different than usual.

* It did not call the imagebackend code for creating non-qcow2 disks,
  instead calling create_image directly. This obviously won't work for
  non-file backends like LVM.

We replace this with a simple iteration over all local disks, calling
create() on each. This ensures that the disk has been initialised on
the live migration target in the same way it was initialised on the
source host.

_create_images_and_backing has no further callers, so we remove it and
its tests. Test coverage remains because we are now calling existing
common code rather than separate code. Specifically:

* test_create_images_and_backing_qcow2
  test_create_images_and_backing_raw

    Tested by individual backend tests

* test_create_images_and_backing_images_not_exist_no_fallback
  test_create_images_and_backing_images_not_exist_fallback

    Tested by RefactorShimTestCase

* test_create_images_and_backing_images_exist

    This test was only relevant to hard reboot. The new code is never
    called in a context where the target might exist.

* test_create_images_and_backing_ephemeral_gets_created

    Tested in test_pre_live_migration_with_not_shared_instance_path

* test_create_images_and_backing_disk_info_none

    Tested in storagepolicy.

The pre_live_migration tests are updated to use StoragePolicyFixture.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ic7b3058f14fbbf05ac70e4e284374bc9c4a5906c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/342224/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: Add create_from_image & create_from_func for Qcow2

These new methods replace the shim implementation which calls
Image.cache() and Qcow2.create_image().

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Co-Authored-By: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I55a4053f6cc4afc3d291f3776a48525b8caa2d13

subject: Documentation for complex LDAP options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 23:13:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-ldap/commit/8c15859f56f6e8a53e38759bf6700e350270f965', 'message': 'Documentation for complex LDAP options

LDAP configurations can be quite complex. ldap-config-flags provides
the mechanism to pass arbitrary configuration options to keystone to
interact with LDAP.

The original documentation only mentions a comma delimited string.
However, the code can handle much more complicated real world
requirements as long as they are in a string format it can consume.

This change documents the specific string format for a complex real
world example both in the README and in config.yaml.

Change-Id: If95eae2a8560d9feeaff66fbe52cab6b2593f5cf
Closes-bug: #1674841

commit_message:
Documentation for complex LDAP options

LDAP configurations can be quite complex. ldap-config-flags provides
the mechanism to pass arbitrary configuration options to keystone to
interact with LDAP.

The original documentation only mentions a comma delimited string.
However, the code can handle much more complicated real world
requirements as long as they are in a string format it can consume.

This change documents the specific string format for a complex real
world example both in the README and in config.yaml.

Change-Id: If95eae2a8560d9feeaff66fbe52cab6b2593f5cf
Closes-bug: #1674841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-ldap refs/changes/57/449357/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding device_present field to bdm table

This change is part of changes for implementing the attach and detach boot
volume for instances in shelved_offloaded state.
When a boot volume is detached its block device mapping will be replaced
with a block device mapping indicates that there is no volume, the new
block device mapping record will have the new field "device_present" set
to False.
Setting that field to False will indicate that the block device mapping
is a place holder for a missing device and cannot be used.

blueprint: detach-boot-volume
Change-Id: I22030c018b6414eaa2196e59b5857170586cb805

subject: Attach/detach root volume for shelved_offloaded
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 12:55:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/24905db9ba71782a8b6ba5687eba314429302732', 'message': 'WIP: Attach/detach root volume for shelved_offloaded

This change is part of a series to allow the attach and detach of a root
volume for instances in shelved_offloaded state.
The key point here is the concept of "no volume" block device mapping.
In I22030c018b6414eaa2196e59b5857170586cb805 we introduce a new field
for the block device mapping table called device_present.
If this field is False that means the root volume of the instance has
been detached.
In this change we have modified the attach process to allow the attach
of a root volume only if the instance has a "no volume" block device
mapping for the root device and the instance is shelved_offloaded.
When we attach a root volume we are going to delete the "no device" bdm
record.
We have also modified the detach process.
To allow a detach of a root volume the instance must be in
shelved_offloaded state.
When we detach the root device we update the
bdm record setting the device_present field equals to False, that
will flag that the instance has a "no volume" bdm associated.

blueprint: detach-boot-volume
Change-Id: If5298e347f6f0f2f9f22f392283a6ad7e0ad7cef
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-17 15:52:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8ffae9be9f653eee87c7e03c9f4d212955b2a7a6', 'message': 'WIP: Attach/detach root volume for shelved_offloaded

We have also modified the detach process.

This change is part of a series to allow the attach and detach of a root
volume for instances in shelved_offloaded state.

In I22030c018b6414eaa2196e59b5857170586cb805 we introduce a new field
for the block device mapping table called device_present.

been detached.

of a root volume only if the instance has a "no volume" block device

When we attach a root volume we are going to delete the "no device" bdm
record.
We have also modified the detach process.
To allow a detach of a root volume the instance must be in
shelved_offloaded state.
When we detach the root device we update the
bdm record setting the device_present field equals to False, that
will flag that the instance has a "no volume" bdm associated.

commit_message:
Attach/detach root volume for shelved_offloaded

This change is part of a series to allow the attach and detach of a root
volume for instances in shelved_offloaded state.
The key point here is the concept of "no volume" block device mapping.
In I22030c018b6414eaa2196e59b5857170586cb805 we introduce a new field
for the block device mapping table called device_present.
If this field is False that means the root volume of the instance has
been detached.
In this change we have modified the attach process to allow the attach
of a root volume only if the instance has a "no volume" block device
mapping for the root device and the instance is shelved_offloaded.
When we attach a root volume we are going to delete the "no device" bdm
record.
We have also modified the detach process.
To allow a detach of a root volume the instance must be in
shelved_offloaded state.
When we detach the root device we update the bdm record
setting the device_present field equals to False, that
will flag that the instance has a "no volume" bdm associated.

blueprint: detach-boot-volume
Change-Id: If5298e347f6f0f2f9f22f392283a6ad7e0ad7cef

commit_message:
Enabling detach root volume for shelved_offloaded

This change allows to detach a root volume if the instance is in
shelved_offloaded state.
This change has the new API microversion to allow the operation
implemented by: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317446/

APIImpact

Change-Id: I08d2dc8685484a39b6c92fa2e65b82ab93a0a7f6
blueprint: detach-boot-volume

commit_message:
Remove deprecated config option sqlite_db

We deprecated config options sqlite_db in July, 2016 [1], and
it shows up in many projects' config files but these projects
don't use it either, so it's confusing to our users. It's time
to remove it, just use config option connection or slave_connection
to connect to the database.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338047/

Closes-Bug: #1329086

Change-Id: Id269d921e40edf95eb977b011f1753f633b79d18

commit_message:
Don't call setup_networks_on_host(dest) multiple times

We were calling setup_networks_on_host(dest) in pre_live_migration,
and twice during post_live_migration_at_destination. The calls on
post_live_migration_at_destination are not obviously required, so we
remove them.

Change-Id: I432607adfa45f3e70029d46059295629801d82f1

commit_message:
Last chance call to neutron if VIF plugin notification is lost

Nova could check real state of each port in Neutron just before
setting the instance in ERROR (if at least one port is not ACTIVE).

Change-Id: Iaec57ab92367ca6308a9d9d6ca3c0b9b46e12976

commit_message:
Add online data migrations to lower case metadata keys

This commit adds a new set of online data migrations that will
alter the keys of all rows in the aggregate_metadata, flavors extra
specs, and instance metadata tables to be lower case.

Partially-implements bp lowercase-metadata-keys
Change-Id: I4ef0c5ff874c733cecdec3ac4879b13c938d0349

commit_message:
Set node's resources unavailable if no ports associated

Node's resources should not be exposed to nova if there's
no ports associated with it, as if nova boot schedules to
it, ironic driver will also check whether the node is ready
to deploy, so we don't need to waste scheduling.

Change-Id: I0dc25787568c00ce52c675860678315364abe791
Closes-Bug: #1582663

subject: User-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 13:33:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/10e06d424fa0f8de743f174dde6fb2c9bd53ff8c', 'message': 'WIP: User-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation

Allow the user to define a network group for each port.
Each network group will be allocated to a different pool,
thus allowing High Availability configurations.
The network group is allocated to a pci device on creation like so:
"neutron port-create --binding:vnic_type=direct
         --binding-profile='{"network_group":"green"}'
         --name green private"
The physical device is allocated a network group through the
white list config like so:
pci_passthrough_whitelist = {
    "devname":"ens3f0",
    "physical_network":"default",
    "network_group":"red"}

Implements: blueprint user-controlled-sriov-ports-allocation

Change-Id: Ie07450a88d5a3e85646058d25dc31163970bf9cd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 05:00:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a7a31b5a3dfaad274881a9c0c1801db8e2de62f4', 'message': 'WIP: User-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation

commit_message:
User-controlled SR-IOV ports allocation

Allow the user to define a network group for each port.
Each network group will be allocated to a different pool,
thus allowing High Availability configurations.
The network group is allocated to a pci device on creation like so:
"neutron port-create --binding:vnic_type=direct
         --binding-profile='{"network_group":"green"}'
         --name green private"
The physical device is allocated a network group through the
white list config like so:
pci_passthrough_whitelist = {
    "devname":"ens3f0",
    "physical_network":"default",
    "network_group":"green"}

Implements: blueprint user-controlled-sriov-ports-allocation

Change-Id: Ie07450a88d5a3e85646058d25dc31163970bf9cd

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V Shielded VMs spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hyper-v-shielded-vms

Shielded VMs in Windows Server 2016 protect virtual machines from
Hyper-V administrators with the help of encryption technologies.
Attaching vTPM devices to the Hyper-V VMs offers users the
posibility to enhance their security and system integrity.

Currently, the Hyper-V Driver doesn't support Shielded VMs. This
blueprint is addressing this issue.

Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-shielded-vms

Change-Id: I41a7923f9b1a2f50b7885449de8fd88b4a610b01

commit_message:
Repropose expose-host-capabilities to Ocata

Moves spec to Ocata.
Adds details about exposing host hv_specs as a capability.

Adds details about exposing host capabilities through
the nova os-hypervisors API.

Removes details about reporting undiscoverable host capabilities.
Details about it will be added later, after finding a proper way to do it.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I24b4eb67f98dfe1a77c3e267086baf571ee49542
Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

commit_message:
Add host-level memory monitor for scheduling

This blueprint extends Nova's metrics framework to add host-level memory
metrics (e.g., total memory, used memory, percent utilized, etc.) such
that they can be used for the scheduler's metrics weigher. The current
metrics allow for CPU utilization-based scheduling and this extends that
capability to memory utilization-based scheduling.

Change-Id: If65faa924d1fd8ca8332be61a6d7d22d164eea10
Blueprint: host-memory-metrics

commit_message:
Add update_attachment API

Currently, cinder stores the Nova host when a volume is attached.
When Nova performs 'evacuate' or 'live migration', the nova host and
connector_info will change. These can also change for Nova shelve_offload.
In order to keep host info up to date, we need an API to update it when it
changes.

Change-Id: I9ed8a9591d9d1098686a0836b08d30020916b6c4
Implements: blueprint update-attachment-api

subject: swift: Skip list_extensions if discoverability=False
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-06 13:48:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/verify_tempest_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9d09b9d5416432990873865936b07107c96618fc', 'message': 'swift: Skip list_extensions if discoverability=False

tempest verify-tempest-config calls list_extensions for
swift service unconditionally, which inturn calls /info
API of the swift endpoint. Some swift endpoints (eg: ceph
radosgw) may not support the /info API and thus fail the
verify step. See [1]

This patch fixes it by calling list_extensions only if
CONF.object_storage_feature_enabled.discoverability is True.

Thus swift-compatible endpoints (eg: radosgw) can set the conf
variable to False to avoid tempest calling /info API, until
it can support the same and thus allow tempest to proceed
running the tests.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-January/083305.html

Change-Id: I7aff1b0f031ae3d5a8aa8426d7c945d6195201b5
'}]
commit_message:
swift: Skip list_extensions if discoverability=False

tempest verify-tempest-config calls list_extensions for
swift service unconditionally, which inturn calls /info
API of the swift endpoint. Some swift endpoints (eg: ceph
radosgw) may not support the /info API and thus fail the
verify step. See [1]

This patch fixes it by calling list_extensions only if
CONF.object_storage_feature_enabled.discoverability is True.

Thus swift-compatible endpoints (eg: radosgw) can set the conf
variable to False to avoid tempest calling /info API, until
it can support the same and thus allow tempest to proceed
running the tests.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-January/083305.html

Change-Id: I7aff1b0f031ae3d5a8aa8426d7c945d6195201b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/79/264179/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix the bug in 'Delete Extra Spec'

The cause is that ID of a single object is passed as the argument
so we need to convert it into an array (iterable) so that delete the
volume_type's extra spec return success.

Change-Id: I7d2225e5497748faf20345fd2579c359fff9f3fb
Closes-Bug: #1643417

Add gnocchi support in basic_consolidation strategy

This patch adds gnocchi support in basic_consolidation strategy
and adds unit tests corresponding to that change.

With multiple qemu-img processes running at the same time the host machine

commit_message:
Limit memory usage when running qemu-img

With multiple qemu-img processes running at the same time the host machine
can quickly run out of memory. This patch is limiting the memory space
to 1 GiB when invoking qemu-img.

Change-Id: If791452edc38c4732ba2b96220e7969c72b234dd
Closes-Bug: #1657808
(cherry picked from commit 4ae48d0b212c16c8b49d4f1144c073b3a3206597)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/55/422855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix: SnapshotStatus missing in Cinder

Now we have introduced SnapshotStatus in Cinder,
but some places still miss changing to use it.
So this bug will fix them quickly.

Change-Id: I99cc33c540cb0781635aba4309a083633e43952f
Closes-Bug: #1672918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/25/445725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Distributed serialization implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 14:18:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/61bc9fde1e28cc4467bdd3adb75b5a6887da5837', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation draft

Distributed serialization is implemented by using dispy library.
On the master node we are creating JobCluster for processing tasks.
Tasks are sent to the Fuel cluster nodes and bootstrap nodes for
serialization (let's call them computation nodes).
On the computatin nodes should be installed fuel-web package and run
dispynode.py. fuel-web is used as library only and there are no
services running on the computation nodes. Also one dispynode
instance started on the master node.
For enabling distributed serialization on cluster set cluster
attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:
LCM_DS_ENABLED = True.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-14 14:36:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/f44a10a74637eae11e3b54a19bd85090c72cceb3', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation draft

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2017-02-27 16:22:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/9680b2cacbe816b8b7519b48d3ebf05bb67ed4ea', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented by using dispy library.
On the master node we are creating JobCluster for processing tasks.
Tasks are sent to the Fuel cluster nodes for serialization (let's
call them computation nodes).
On the computatin nodes should be installed fuel-web package and
dispynode.py should be running. fuel-web is used as library only
and there are no naulgun services running on the computation nodes.
Also one dispynode instance should be started on the master node.
For enabling distributed serialization on cluster set cluster
attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:
LCM_DS_ENABLED = True.
For minimisation of load on the network we are sending transaction
context and nailgun.settings to the each worker only once before
computation is started. Transaction context and nailgun.settings
on the computation nodes saved for each transaction in different
files.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization
"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-28 09:48:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/16df8312c0b69865c8ef0413e1abceed0ec22d68', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented by using dispy library.
On the master node we are creating JobCluster for processing tasks.
Tasks are sent to the Fuel cluster nodes for serialization (let's
call them computation nodes).
On the computatin nodes should be installed fuel-web package and
dispynode.py should be running. fuel-web is used as library only
and there are no naulgun services running on the computation nodes.
Also one dispynode instance should be started on the master node.
For enabling distributed serialization on cluster set cluster
attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:
LCM_DS_ENABLED = True.
For minimisation of load on the network we are sending transaction
context and nailgun.settings to the each worker only once before
computation is started. Transaction context and nailgun.settings
on the computation nodes saved for each transaction in different
files.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2017-03-01 13:19:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/5d1260f74aabfc4beb9a8e918abd8269000f1de0', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented by using dispy library.
On the master node we are creating JobCluster for processing tasks.
Tasks are sent to the Fuel cluster nodes for serialization (let's
call them computation nodes).
On the computatin nodes should be installed fuel-web package and
dispynode.py should be running. fuel-web is used as library only
and there are no naulgun services running on the computation nodes.
Also one dispynode instance should be started on the master node.
For enabling distributed serialization on cluster set cluster
attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:
LCM_DS_ENABLED = True.
For minimisation of load on the network we are sending transaction
context and nailgun.settings to the each worker only once before
computation is started. They will be loaded into memory at the
beginning of the computation and removed after all jobs are done.
Nodes liveness checking and jobs managing is implemented by dispy
library.
We are resubmit job if it has Cancelled, Abandoned or Treminated
status.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:

and nailgun.settings to the each worker only once before computation

"}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2017-03-07 13:27:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/e70a67a2b602fcfd9bc17bb64ca986d41b696344', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented by using dispy library.
On the master node we create JobCluster for processing tasks.
Tasks are sent to the master node and Fuel cluster nodes for
serialization (let's call them computation nodes).
On the computatin nodes should be installed fuel-web package and
dispynode.py should be running. fuel-web is used as library only
and there are no naulgun services running on the computation nodes.
Also one dispynode instance should be started on the master node.
For enabling distributed serialization on cluster set cluster
attribute ['common']['serialization_policy']['value'] = 'distributed'
or enable for all clusters through settings.yaml parameter:
LCM_DS_ENABLED = True.
For minimisation of load on the network we send transaction context
and nailgun.settings to the each worker only once before computation
is started. The context and settings will be loaded into memory at the
beginning of the computation and removed after all jobs of the
computation are done.
After computation is finished dispy worker process will be stopped
for cleaning fetched memory and remove side effects of the
computation. Dispy worker process will be started automatically
by the systemd.
Nodes liveness checking and jobs managing is implemented by dispy
library.
We are resubmit job if it has Cancelled, Abandoned or Treminated
status.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization
"}, {'number': 25, 'created': '2017-03-20 14:32:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/08aeac71ab016cd9bcf3a93f3147804227beb54c', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented with python distributed
library. We have scheduler for jobs management and workers for
jobs processing. Scheduler is started on the master node as well
as set of workers on it. Also workers are started on all nodes.
In the cluster settings we can select the type of serialization
and nodes statuses that allows serialization on it. By default
nodes with status 'ready' are excluded from the workers list.

For data serialization we are using only nodes from the cluster
where serialization is performing.

Before the computation fresh nailgun code is sent to the workers
as zip file and it will be imported for job execution. So we always
have fresh nailgun code on the workers.

In one job we are processing chunks of tasks on the workers. This
approach significantly boosts performance. The tasks chunk size
is defined as settings.LCM_DS_TASKS_PER_JOB parameter.

For limiting memory consumption on the master node we use parameter
settings.LCM_DS_NODE_LOAD_COEFF for calculation max number of jobs
in the processing queue.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization
"}, {'number': 26, 'created': '2017-03-20 14:50:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/0cf0e29a4038c63baf9f52b9e38b7709d692240c', 'message': "Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented with python distributed
library. We have scheduler for jobs management and workers for
jobs processing. Scheduler is started on the master node as well
as set of workers on it. Also workers are started on all nodes.
In the cluster settings we can select the type of serialization
and nodes statuses that allows serialization on it. By default
nodes with status 'ready' are excluded from the workers list.

For data serialization we are using only nodes from the cluster
where serialization is performing.

Before the computation fresh nailgun code is sent to the workers
as zip file and it will be imported for job execution. So we always
have fresh nailgun code on the workers.

In one job we are processing chunks of tasks on the workers. This
approach significantly boosts performance. The tasks chunk size
is defined as settings.LCM_DS_TASKS_PER_JOB parameter.

For limiting memory consumption on the master node we use parameter
settings.LCM_DS_NODE_LOAD_COEFF for calculation max number of jobs
in the processing queue.

Synthetic tests of distributed serialization for 500 nodes with
nubmer of ifaces >= 5 performed on 40 cores (4 different machines)
took 6-7 minutes on average.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Depends-On: Idae764bde0b0dd482e6b08d69a97cd5d0717547d
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

Distributed serialization is implemented with python distributed
library. We have scheduler for jobs management and workers for
jobs processing. Scheduler is started on the master node as well
as set of workers on it. Also workers are started on all nodes.
In the cluster settings we can select the type of serialization
and nodes statuses that allows serialization on it. By default
nodes with status 'ready' are excluded from the workers list.

For data serialization we are using only nodes from the cluster
where serialization is performing.

Before the computation fresh nailgun code is sent to the workers
as zip file and it will be imported for job execution. So we always
have fresh nailgun code on the workers.

In one job we are processing chunks of tasks on the workers. This
approach significantly boosts performance. The tasks chunk size
is defined as settings.LCM_DS_TASKS_PER_JOB parameter.

For limiting memory consumption on the master node we use parameter
settings.LCM_DS_NODE_LOAD_COEFF for calculation max number of jobs
in the processing queue.

Synthetic tests of distributed serialization for 500 nodes with
nubmer of ifaces >= 5 performed on 40 cores (4 different machines)
took 6-7 minutes on average.

commit_message:
Distributed serialization implementation

Distributed serialization is implemented with python distributed
library. We have scheduler for jobs management and workers for
jobs processing. Scheduler is started on the master node as well
as set of workers on it. Also workers are started on all nodes.
In the cluster settings we can select the type of serialization
and nodes statuses that allows serialization on it. By default
nodes with status 'ready' are excluded from the workers list.

For data serialization we are using only nodes from the cluster
where serialization is performing.

Before the computation fresh nailgun code is sent to the workers
as zip file and it will be imported for job execution. So we always
have fresh nailgun code on the workers.

In one job we are processing chunks of tasks on the workers. This
approach significantly boosts performance. The tasks chunk size
is defined as settings.LCM_DS_TASKS_PER_JOB parameter.

For limiting memory consumption on the master node we use parameter
settings.LCM_DS_NODE_LOAD_COEFF for calculation max number of jobs
in the processing queue.

Synthetic tests of distributed serialization for 500 nodes with
nubmer of ifaces >= 5 performed on 40 cores (4 different machines)
took 6-7 minutes on average.

Change-Id: Id8ff8fada2f1ab036775fc01c78d91befdda9ea2
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

commit_message:
VMAX driver - consistency group remove empty values

For consistency group 'volume_type_id' is split based on a comma
because 'volume_type_id' is represented as a single string even
though it may contain multiple id. This creates an empty value in
the list. This fix removes empty values from the list of volume
types.

Change-Id: I8280989d25149e1f87ab2ffac0a61f1bc3321cff
Closes-Bug: #1664621
(cherry picked from commit 3bbfe2606be4d02b54cbfff68e85986f6a68e1b6)

commit_message:
Switch trunk/cbs/buildlogs to use https

There is a permanent redirection from http to https in buildlogs, cbs
and trunk repos that might create issues when the redirection fails for
some reasons.
Let's use https directly.

Change-Id: Id1f900dd60bc7264fc0ed9d7ce55051e446dce8c

commit_message:
Add vagrantfile for AIO testing

This patch adds a vagrantfile which enables the build
of an All-In-One (AIO) using vagrant and virtualbox.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/438254
- https://review.openstack.org/449150

Change-Id: Ief7bcac92f06a5dab709639bf281f23c12b84e45
(cherry picked from commit dfdda462395d97f9308f2a332862fc786aac2098)

subject: Refactors exceptions in rbac_rule_validation decorator.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 14:18:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/2740285c24d43c12d719efcde97b53306de2034e', 'message': 'Refactors exceptions in rbac_rule_validation decorator.

Currently, rbac_rule_validation decorator repeats code
underneath "except expected_exception" and "except RbacActionFailed".
These 2 blocks fo code can be merged by using a tuple that
contains both of these exceptions on 1 line.

This patch makes the above change. It also adds a new exception
block for a wildcard exception. If a 404 is expected but a 403 is
thrown, the 403 is caught and an error message saying that the
expected error code differs from the one caught is then re-raised.
That is, a more informative error message is thrown than
otherwise would be.

This patch finally fixes test_expect_not_found_but_raises_forbidden
which was expecting a 404 but raising a 404 via mock's side_effect,
when instead a 404 should be expected and a 403 thrown.

Change-Id: Idea4a45f721893c997acbfb2a1beb978ccfe11e6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-22 14:25:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/df3457505387d96bc2163d038b5e7ca88ae18dd4', 'message': 'Refactors exceptions in rbac_rule_validation decorator.

thrown, the 403 is caught and an error message saying that the
expected error code differs from the one caught is then re-raised.
That is, a more informative error message is thrown than
otherwise would be.

This patch finally fixes test_expect_not_found_but_raises_forbidden
which was expecting a 404 but raising a 404 via mock's side_effect,

Change-Id: Idea4a45f721893c997acbfb2a1beb978ccfe11e6
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-22 17:16:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/c7701c3ed89b42f9f38d8145850646f1d465666b', 'message': 'Refactors exceptions in rbac_rule_validation decorator.

thrown, the 403 is caught and an error message saying that the
expected error code differs from the one caught is then re-raised.
That is, a more informative error message is thrown than
otherwise would be.

which was expecting a 404 but raising a 404 via mock's side_effect,
when instead a 404 should be expected and a 403 thrown.

commit_message:
Refactors exceptions in rbac_rule_validation decorator.

Currently, rbac_rule_validation decorator repeats code
underneath "except expected_exception" and "except RbacActionFailed".
These 2 blocks of code can be merged by using a tuple that
contains both of these exceptions on 1 line.

This patch makes the above change. It also adds a new exception
block for a wildcard exception. If a 404 is expected but a 403 is
thrown, the 403 is caught and an error message saying that the
expected error code differs from the one caught is then re-raised.
That is, a more informative error message is thrown than
otherwise would be.

This patch finally improves upon rbac_rule_validation unit tests by:
 - removing redundant tests
 - renames tests to make them more understandable
 - adds docstrings to each tests to make them more understandable

Change-Id: Idea4a45f721893c997acbfb2a1beb978ccfe11e6

commit_message:
Packages for distributed serialization added to provision

We are going to use provisioned cluster nodes as workers for
distributed task serialization. Package python-distributed
provides dask-worker for nailgun code execution. Other packages
are nailgun requirements.

Change-Id: I95b7682c64fe2eedb26fc80046909974cc792c91
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

commit_message:
Bump prlimit cpu time for qemu-img from 2 to 8

Users have reported that the current CPU limit is not
sufficient for processing large enough images when
downloading images to volumes.

This mirrors a similar increase made in Nova (b78b1f8ce).

Closes-Bug: #1646181

Change-Id: I5edea7d1d19fd991e51dca963d2beb7004177498
(cherry picked from commit 52310fa8645cc10b91de7d2b4e10a3b42d4ef073)
(cherry picked from commit 2a5e0086e130e5e7960f743b6db8344caf65b9e5)

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin clean-up

Currently calling clean.sh leads to NEUTRON_LBAAS_DASHBOARD_ENABLE_FILE
being deleted. The problem is that this variable contains path to a
file in neutron-lbaas-dashboard directory, not its copy in Horizon
directory. This patch fixes this by deleting proper files.

Change-Id: I9fcb96e4a0928a2b6a9da3e70dbb0e185dff7108
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard refs/changes/50/337650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Unify output formatting, add logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 23:06:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/e5cd5a07979e657f7ff1813cb612d080a3987c9d', 'message': "Unify output formatting, add logging

Since there is no central storage for the restart actions and the tests
at the moment, they should have timestamped output to correlate events.
Using a standard format will make this easier to do programmatically,
too.

The output is sent both to stdout and a log file. Additionally, Ansible
output is suppressed now, so it doesn't pollute the console.

The `configure_logging` function was copied into the tests/keystone.py
file instead of put into a common module in order to keep that file a
standalone unit for the time being.

Change-Id: I399d1827a8559896ca87e45c00241293ccd033d2

commit_message:
Unify output formatting, add logging

Since there is no central storage for the restart actions and the tests
at the moment, they should have timestamped output to correlate events.
Using a standard format will make this easier to do programmatically,
too.

The output is sent both to stdout and a log file. Additionally, Ansible
output is suppressed now, so it doesn't pollute the console. Log times
are in UTC, to avoid timezone mismatches between nodes (observed in
multi-node AIOs).

The `configure_logging` function was copied into the tests/keystone.py
file instead of put into a common module in order to keep that file a
standalone unit for the time being.

Change-Id: I399d1827a8559896ca87e45c00241293ccd033d2

commit_message:
Provide example of using veth pairs for br-vlan

When the neutron agent is not containerized on compute
hosts a veth pair is needed to provide a non-bridge interface
in order to access br-vlan for tenant vlans.

Related-Bug: 1656344
Related-Bug: 1399432

Change-Id: Id1ee07a1d0720b35c908221fc560c188f3444c64
(cherry picked from commit 8152a1586292cd4d52d1462f6b0ef48b5077b93c)

commit_message:
Add new regex for "slow test" gate

Include "Type" to ensure that only slow tests
are executed in "slow test" gate and fast tests
are executed in "fast test"gate

commit_message:
Exit with error code when overcloud wasn't deployed

If overcloud stack wasn't deployed successfully, exit with code 1
without depending on exit code of tripleoclient.

Close-Bug: #1674955

commit_message:
Only force http for repos that allow it

It seems that trying to use http for CBS repos causes a lot of
spurious failures due to the forced redirect to https.  Since we
only care about using http for the delorean repos that allow it,
limit the repo sed to just those urls.

Change-Id: I55ebe1d3963055d27c37cd5e9a299dcf929c84ec
Partial-Bug: 1674681

commit_message:
Cleanup doc warnings and enforce warning-is-error in sphinx

* doc/source/conf.py: html_static_path pointed to nonexisting dir
* Fix indent error in python codes
* Insert blank lines before starting code block
* Enable warning-is-error in setup.cfg to prevent future warnings
* 'all_files' should be 'all-files' in setup.cfg

Change-Id: I7c5bc31be9c95ec78f18f895014a03cb003d7e04

commit_message:
Extend monasca-notification spec

Rename package from python-monasca-notification to
openstack-monasca-notification. Core Python monasca-notification
is right now as a subpackage. Add configuration and service
files. Add creating configuration and log folders plus
assigning user and group.

Change-Id: I3855ad98bf32c1df1ab4210bea858f69d843338c

commit_message:
Add support for clients/endpoint_type

Add support for clients/endpoint_type parameter.

Note: Default to False now, because TripleO already sets this resource.
      and we don't want duplicated resource.
      Once we switch TripleO to use this new option, the default will
      become os_service_default.

Change-Id: If707c5623c0e34e9219eeafdafaf0ac42daf5c8d
Closes-Bug: #1675409

commit_message:
Add support for clients/endpoint_type

Add support for clients/endpoint_type parameter.

Note: Default to False now, because TripleO already sets this resource.
      and we don't want duplicated resource.
      Once we switch TripleO to use this new option, the default will
      become os_service_default.

Change-Id: If707c5623c0e34e9219eeafdafaf0ac42daf5c8d
Closes-Bug: #1675409
(cherry picked from commit b865f447d906f0572b0a8f588c525c908cd0fa7b)

commit_message:
Fix manage_service parameter

Previously even if manage_service was set to false, we were always
attempting to define the octavia-api service within puppet. This change
updates the manage_service to control skipping the definition of the
octavia-api service.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6d2729b3e22f4c434da098ea180a9d11cf73058b
Closes-Bug: 1633001

commit_message:
Use eventlet version of subprocess

Eventlet doesn't patch subprocess module, see bug [1]. As result
trying to catch subprocess.CalledProcessError exception wouldn't
work. So use subprocess module from eventlet.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/357

Closes-Bug: #1675744
Change-Id: I4a744cef35e9f58c532d979ce61c912cfdfccd97

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

TrivialFix
Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo.config version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I321543b1acb3ece6877f9a9c35d10cd798716580
